title: Unexpected crash at mod.rs
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (8478c08 2022-05-05T00:13:22.824937+00:00)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (M1)

### Describe the bug

The issue seemingly happens when function arguments lead to a possibly reverting execution, which does not revert in the test though since it crashes as above.

We limit the call input via mock length, but dont check that mock is shorter than input data:
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/2d19cc2dee165f6ecb3aafe62034d1fb370a69f9/evm/src/executor/inspector/cheatcodes/mod.rs#L127

The following line should be fixed as well:
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/2d19cc2dee165f6ecb3aafe62034d1fb370a69f9/evm/src/executor/inspector/cheatcodes/mod.rs#L116
Don't think anything needs to be changed on https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/2d19cc2dee165f6ecb3aafe62034d1fb370a69f9/evm/src/executor/inspector/cheatcodes/mod.rs#L116 ?
